Canada Skateboard Presents:
2022 NATIONAL DOWNHILL TEAM
Meet Our Athletes

About

Our goal is to send Canadaâ€™s Downhill Skateboarding Team of 6 men and 6 women to compete against the world's best at the 2022 World Skate Games, being held in Argentina, South America.
  • When? October 24, 2022 - November 13, 2022
  • Where? San Juan, Argentina

    • Check out the World Skate Games Official Event Page for more info

    • What is the World Skate Games?

      Overseen by the International Olympic Committee, the World Skate Games consists of 12 sports, and ~7000 athletes representing 80 countries, the highest level of competition in the world.

    • Canada holds the defending Championship

      In 2019, Canadian Dane Hanna brought home the Gold, taking 1st place in Barcelona, Spain. Post-pandemic, the WSG is back and team Canada plans to earn that Gold once again.

    Sponsor Our Athletes

    Set up our Athletes for Success

    Safety Equipment

    Safety of our riders is our number 1 priority. Safety equipment includes: full leather racing suits with CE certified padding, FR-7 Certified fullface helmets, slide gloves, and brakesoles.

    Travel Expenses

    Help us get our team to the world finals! Travel Expenses Include: Insurance, Airfare, and Transportation.

    Accommodation

    [something abut accommodation]

    TEAM CANADA 2022

    We're sending 12 of our top Downhill Athletes to compete in the 2022 World Roller Games, taking place in Argentina this fall.

    Men's Downhill Team:
    Dane Hanna
    Pender Harbour, BC
    Dexter Manning
    Toronto, ON
    Troy Grenier
    Abbostford, BC
    Clayton Arthurs
    North Vancouver, BC
    Samuel Sidorchuk
    Vancouver, BC
    Cam Brickenden
    Toronto, ON

    Women's Downhill Team:
    Katerina Hill
    Abbotsford, BC
    Tessa Campbell
    West Vancouver, BC
    Amie Sheppard
    Caledon, ON
    Anna O'Neill
    [Hometown - Anna]
    Diane Hiebert
    Abbotsford, BC
    Elycia Finch
    Kamloops, BC
